Quick search

Accessing raster attributes¶

GeoWombat has additional raster attributes on top of Xarray/Rasterio attributes¶

In [1]: import geowombat as gw

In [2]: from geowombat.data import rgbn

Access raster attributes using the file opening API (Reading and writing files).

In [3]: with gw.open(rgbn) as ds:
   ...:     print(ds.gw.meta)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.ndims)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.nbands)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.nrows)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.ncols)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.left)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.right)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.top)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.bottom)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.bounds)
   ...:     print(ds.gw.geometry)
   ...: 
Meta(left=792988.0, right=795563.0, top=2050382.0, bottom=2048367.0, bounds=(792988.0, 2048367.0, 795563.0, 2050382.0), affine=Affine(5.0, 0.0, 792988.0,
       0.0, -5.0, 2050382.0), geometry=<shapely.geometry.polygon.Polygon object at 0x2aaaad6c8710>)
